org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.browser
Class PlotPanel

java.lang.Object
  com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.UIObject
      com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
          org.timepedia.chronoscope.client.browser.PlotPanel
All Implemented Interfaces:
com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.ResizeHandler, com.google.gwt.event.shared.EventHandler, com.google.gwt.event.shared.HasHandlers, com.google.gwt.user.client.EventListener, SafariKeyboardConstants, ViewReadyCallback, org.timepedia.exporter.client.Exportable
public class PlotPanel
extends com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
implements ViewReadyCallback, com.google.gwt.event.logical.shared.ResizeHandler, SafariKeyboardConstants

ChartPanel is a GWT Widget that intercepts events and translates them to the Chart interface as well as creating a View instance for the chart to render with. All client-side browser-specific classes reside in the browser subpackage to ensure the portability of the rest of Chronoscope to other environments (Applet, Servlet, etc)

ChartPanel at the moment only handles XYPlots, but in the future will be extended to handle other chart types. See the project wiki for more details.

A simple way to construct a chart looks like this: 

 ChartPanel chartPanel = new ChartPanel(myDatasets);
 RootPanel.get("someid").add(chartPanel);

Author:
Ray Cromwell <ray@timepedia.org>

onViewReady

public void onViewReady(View view)
Invoked when a BrowserView is finished construction and ready for rendering. Chart initialization is delayed until view creation, because Chart initialization depends on measuring font metrics, CSS styles, and other view-centric operations.

Specified by:
onViewReady in interface ViewReadyCallback

onAttach

protected void onAttach()
When this widget is attached, a BrowserView is constructed. Views are responsible for providing rendering and CSS services. A BrowserView may be created asynchronously (as is the case with Flash, Silverlight, and others) and therefore super.onAttach() is not called until onViewReady is invoked.

Overrides:
onAttach in class com.google.gwt.user.client.ui.Widget
